resources.string: Bluetooth is not enabled on your device. Please enable Bluetooth to continue.

You are attempting to connect to a remote Sony camera using Sony\'s \'Camera Remote API\'. If you do not see the camera you are looking for, make sure that this device is connected to the Sony camera\'s WiFi network.
Select your power meter below. If it isn\'t there, make sure you have Bluetooth paired this device to it. For Quasar Power Meters, the PIN is most likely 1234.
Select your headset below. Make sure that you have paired that headset to this device, this application is running on the headset, and Bluetooth is enabled on the headset.
Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history

The Vuzix M100 is an Android powered headset that is capable of streaming video both on-device and from the external device. The M100 needs Bluetooth to communicate with the external device. In order to make the connections, simply pair the two devices before using the application. You can use the on-device buttons to navigate the various menus.

The Vuzix M300 is an Android powered headset that is capable of streaming video both on-device and from the external device as well as understanding voice commands. The M300 needs Bluetooth to communicate with the external device. In order to make the connections, simply pair the two devices before using the application. You can use voice control or the on-device buttons to navigate the various menus.

Google Glass provides a cutting edge interface to the laser. Glass supports voice commands and streaming (via Bluetooth). In order to pair a Glass headset to an external device, use the MyGlass application provided by Google. Once paired, you can communicate with the glass headset using various gestures or voice commands.
When enabled, the device will show log messages via snackbars. If this is disabled, messages will still be added to the log. Nice for large displays, not so nice otherwise.

If you\'re going to point this device\'s camera at the laser, then choose this option.\n\nUsing the device as a server allows you to connect to other devices, such as headsets and other phones or tablets.

If you want to view the laser through this device from across the room, for example, choose this option.\n\nUsing the phone as a client will allow other devices acting as a server to connect it and share their view.
This app requires additional user permission to use the camera on any devices running on Android 6.0 (Marshmellow) or newer.

This app requires manual user permission to operate the camera.

If you have selected the "Settings > apps > Lazer Helper > Storage. Once there open the overflow menu and select the "Clear Data" option and reopen this app.

Select the "CANCEL" button to exit the app.
